reviews.review_msg: Lily is a very mediocre professor. She is not very engaging, makes an unclear rubric for grading, writes confusing tests, and allows your mark to be dependent on the quality of your group, rather than individual work. Also, she's not great at using Canvas, and seems to be fairly unwilling to keep her course current
You have to attend lectures. Exam is MCQ only but really tough MCQ's. TA's are no help, and feedback/grading rubric is not clear.

terrible marking system. One of the most boring classes in beedie. you would thing that marketing is interesting, well not with this class. TA's do not know how to mark and I believe are biased. Lily shows no emotions, so easy to fall asleep. Would recommend someone else if you are thinking to concentrate in marketing

I thought Lily had interesting lectures and kept concepts up to date. She uses a lot of real world examples and pop culture as a way to explain concepts. She also gave opportunities for extra credit which was helpful.

Her lectures were okay but the posted slides had missing material from the lectures. Exam questions had multiple answers that were correct but she was only looking for a specific answer. Pray your TA and project team are good.

This class is relatively hard but it's fair. The exam questions are multiple choice and come from the textbook and Lily's lecture slides. I found the projects more time consuming and harder than the exams. Lily is a super organized teacher and very quick to answer questions and communicate, so that's a plus! You'll do good if you put in the time.
not approachable and outdated content with messy slides

Lily is a good lecturer. Her slides aren't littered with text, they have few words with pictures that she speaks to. It's about time a prof has slides that aren't filled with text. Her Exams were fair and based off of lectures and textbook material and are all multiple choice. Overall not a difficult course, just pay attention and read the book.

tough
all mcq midterms worth 50% of course

Lily is a decent professor. She tries her best to make lectures engaging but it is content and memorization-heavy. The exams are a bit tricky as there are many application problems and can sometimes have really specific questions. There is an individual and a group assignment, but they do not have much clear structure and expectations are obscure.

Lily was very average. She teaches what she has from her slides and nothing more. One individual project and one big group project that is straightforward if you get lucky with a good group. As long as you read the textbook and go to lecture it's an easy class that requires mainly memorization. Lots of exam questions come from her lectures.

She uses way to many examples in her video, and its all about memorization and cramming which doesn't really teach students anything. Content is quite outdated to and she speaks so slow!! Lily uses the word to describe the word. Learned not to do this in grade 5... Nothing more to say here.

Lily is not approachable at all! She doesn't care about her students and only listens to her TAs' side of the story. To be honest she does a good job in teaching and the exams are easy, but she never pays enough attention to the tutorials nor the students' complaints. The grading criteria are unclear, and she never provides feedback or comments

Lily is a pretty good prof overall. The class consisted of an individual project plus a recorded presentation, a group project and presentation, a midterm, and a final. This is one of those Beedie classes where you have to memorize material. Lily posts the lectures online, which is great, although I just stuck to reading the textbook and did fine.

I assume she is better in person because she is nice and her assignments were relatively enjoyable. However, her lecture recordings were quite dry, and half of the questions on her exams weren't even related to the textbook, which made the exam result a crap shoot.

I think the other reviews were blown out of proportion. I think her videos were really helpful in painting out the course content, and everything she covered in her lectures covered almost everything for the exams. This was definitely a more difficult course when you consider the amount of content you needed to learn.

She is one of the worst professors at SFU! not an approachable professor, almost seems like she hates this job and hates all the students. She does not offer feedback. Acts like a dictator. Grading system is unfair and does not provide any justifications. AVOID HER AT ALL COSTS

Does not care about her students AT ALL. Zero consideration for any struggles students are facing and simply does the bare minimum. No feedback was provided and grading is not justified. The course teaches you nothing new and the grading means absolutely nothing.

Avoid! Lily only offers recorded lectures (she just read the PowerPoint slides) and help is not available when needed. The worst part of recorded lectures is that this is a 110 minutes lecture but she gives 150+ minutes of recordings for you to watch... Take it with another prof if you want to learn things or receive high grades.

Definitely avoid. She only offers pre-recorded class. Her exam questions take super long to read, you WILL feel you don't have enough time. She give very easy materials in her recordings which is definitely not the same level as her exam questions.

Interesting lectures that were easy to follow along to. If you keep up with the readings and participate in tutorial you'll be fine. Exams were multiple choice and were based on her lectures and textbook material. Biggest differentiator is the paper you have to write that's due at the end of the semester.
fine.

Lecture is straight from the textbook and her lecture brings no value to your learning. Group project is unreasonable and she forces you to create a completely new, never-before-done product and also expects your product to be good and can be monetized/ profitable. Overall I would not recommend taking it with this professor.

She is a good professor. She tries to make every lecture fun by bringing real life examples, and having students participate. The tests are easy, and overall a straight -forward course. I would recommend!

She acts as if her opinions are always right and everyone else's are wrong. She seems to believe that she's the smartest person in the universe.. Doesn't know how to talk to people, extremely arrogant.

She was definitely the worst instructor I had at Beedie. I am not sure why she chose to teach since she doesn't seem to connect with students at all. She would ask us to share our thoughts, and then acted very condescending when you'd share something she doesn't agree with. Very arrogant.
DONOT TAKE HER.....
Very bad instructor, she just read the slides and without any useful explanations, just answered with "yes yes yes"? How can students understand the concepts?
extremely full of himself. Will start the semester off coming off as a nice person but that quickly changes. Test are also very easy as they are all on quizlet.

He was very passionate; however, since some students cheated in the midterm, the average ended up to be in 90s. Thus, to bring down the average, he gave us an unreasonably hard, time-consuming, and vague final to bring down average. Also, the concepts were vague, the textbook and his slides were disorganized, and marking rubric is not provided.

AVOID. Seems passionate about marketing but he did awful with the remote semester. Exams were completely taken from online sources, and since they weren't proctored, seems like most of the class found the answers - average was in the 90s. To bring down the average he gave no assignment criteria and decreased the marks the TAs originally gave.

He is very passionate but the course needs a major revamp. I was disappointed that he did not adjust the course much for online classes... He says closed book exams but there is no proctoring...? I don't see how that works. This was a classic memorize definitions for the exam and then forget it class. The concepts were vague and expectations too.

You can tell that he's trying but at the end of the day, it's not enough. He told us that he made the exam papers specific to the semester. But the exact questions were on the internet so anyone who didn't cheat, didn't do well. Everything was all over the place. No clear instructions or guidelines.
Assignments were very vague. Didn't explain what to do to any of them. I would avoid.

Terrible prof. Very unprofessional as his family randomly shows up in lectures. Not very educated in the material; likes to boast more than teach. Extremely lazy and was very frustrating hearing that he used Quizlet questions for midterms which made the average around 95 percent. So if you did the exams honestly, you had no chance with the curve.

He's a terrible prof. He examines you in a way that doesn't promote learning. For his midterm and final, you have to memorize answers to 42 short answer questions and he selects about 12 from those and tests you on 10. Oh, and he also added a case study to the final on top of that (which is fine, but ridiculous with the additional short answers).
Classes and discussions dragged on. Tried to help, but not particularly helpful. High energy.   If given the choice, I would not take another class with him.

I think Phil was a great prof- super personable and smiled a lot, used good examples and very engaging. You could tell he was very knowledgable about the content- My only future recommendation would be that he go more in depth into less concepts, rather than less in depth into more concepts- as there were certainly A LOT in this intro class..

He is not a professional prof. He emails revised ppts on the day of lecture, makes email announcements hours before lectures, and he basically skims through the ppts during lectures. His midterm is hard because it is almost all situational questions which are open to interpretation. Class is too time consuming for a 3 credit course. Not recommended
He is there to get attention, NOT TEACH!   I THINK he is trying to be FUNNY but he is NOT!!!!!

Classes are hilarious and entertaining. It's crucial that you show up to class, but if you do the exams are really easy. Marketing plan project is comprehensive but doable (just give yourself time). Definitely would take again.

Jason is honestly an incredible prof. I have never met a faculty member who would be willing to do so much outside of his time to help his students. If you need help at ANYTIME, he is always available. He is also hilarious &personable. People who probably rated him low are mad about the content. This course material is dry but Jason does it best!

Although the course is very assignment heavy, the assignments are very useful for practical real life situations. Also by doing the assignments it reinforces your knowledge of marketing concepts taught in class. Exams on a whole were pretty fair, mostly related to the textbook with some in class questions. Clear grading criteria as well.

- Jason is the best marketing prof at SFU. The material is valuable and he uses many relevant real world examples in lectures to supplement the textbook material. - Midterm and final exams were directly from the lectures and textbook; NO SURPRISES. - Marketing Plan and Personal Branding projects are difficult but relevant to real world situations

Not that the content is hard, but the amount of work is overwhelming. It's not merely going to class - which is essential - but it's groups, cases, assignments, events, extra credits... Far too much work, and terrible communication - both virtually, and because of his level of English. Very disappointing, but I did take a lot from the course itself
Asks you to do an incredibly difficult, untaught, and ambiguous marketing plan project in an introductory course, with a randomly assigned group. Not worth the headache.

He is a great professor who is obviously inspired about marketing. However his expectations are way too high, it seems as if he wants to cover everything about marketing in one course (this includes theory and big confusing projects) Even the TAs do not understand his assignments. It is VERY hard work, not worth it at all if you are not a marketing

Ends every other sentence with "yes! that's right!" but nothing ever really feels that right. Too many components to the class. Assignments are ambiguous and not related to textbook. Final is cumulative of a 500 page textbook. More time consuming than this class needs to be. Mark is heavily reliant on TA.

Jason's only fault is his assignments can be ambiguous & it's often hard to know what's required of you. I guess that's like the real world though. He is hilarious & tests only on key terms from the book. A monkey could get 75% on his exams, but memorizing the whole text is what separates the pro's from the amateurs. Group work is time consuming
I really liked Jason's teaching! He was funny and played many videos in class to keep things interesting. His course was a lot of work, but it's a 300 level course so that's expected.

Fills each lecture with very interesting research and many real-life examples to help you understand the course materials. He was one of the most engaging profs I have ever had at SFU. Assignments are difficult and worth a significant portion of your mark (especially the team project) but exams are very fair and quite easy.
Jason is a great prof! Very energetic in class which is great. Exams are fair and very easy if you read the text. Just hope you get a good group for the group project
He is ok, but for me it was really hard to understand the lectures because of the accent, for the final and midterm you need to memorize the WHOLE book to get a good grade

Jason is an enthusiastic prof, but the exam is mostly about regurgitating the textbook. Lectures are kind of useless, but he does test some material on the slides. Exams are all MC. Definitely try to get a good group in your tutorial. The class material is pretty much useless, much to my disappointment.
Jason is awesomecakes. He keeps students engaged every class with relevant examples and a positive attitude. He is very responsive to students' concerns and is always willing to provide extra help.

Jason is a good professor and he is also very funny. Also, a very helpful person compared to some of the TA's(they shall remain anonymous). I would take another class with Jason (however, the bell curve was very weird). If you are like me (Accounting major), you are going to hate this class. MARKETING IS USELESS. Make sure you have a good group

Great prof with a great sense of humour! He sure knows how to keep the class attentive and is very knowledgeable in the course. Exams were fair with mc questions from about 80% textbook, 20% from the lecture (videos, case examples. Would love to take another course with Jason!

very entertaining prof, keeps the class awake with videos and examples we can relate to, doesn't just follow the textbook. the group project was a pain in the a**, but i guess if you have a good group the course would be great, considering the mt and final were easy with only multiple choice

You definitely want to take BUS 343 with Jason Ho - he's hilarious and he clearly knows his stuff. This is the ONE class where the attendance rate is consistently high, up to the very last class! You will want to pursue marketing after taking a course with him. Assignments, group work, and exams were very fair- no surprises.

Jason is a fun and easy-going guy. Unfortunately, he is difficult to understand and has a tough time getting to the point. He often spends 30-45 minutes on his first 3 slides, causing the class to run overtime every week. Besides a few interesting videos and stories, I really didn't learn much from his lectures. I would go with Krider next time.

the guy downstairs means to say his exams are 30% based on lecture material and 70% based on textbook. Jason is very humourous and easy going. however this course demands a lot of group work! make sure u get good group members or u'll suffer like i did.
He's a really awesome prof and you have to attend lectures if you want to get an A,because his exams are 30%lecture,30%textbook and not lecture and 40%both text&lecture.
Super easy class. He's very nice and approachable. Group projects are annoying. Sometimes may be difficult to understand because of his Russel Peters Chinese accent.

I thought he really tried to make the lectures interesting. He'd often play clips of commercials that was related to the material. Always in a good mood, and the exams are fair. Just read the text and study.

At first I didn't like him at all. His lectures were super long and hard to absorb. However, if you actually pay attention, you see he has a genuine interest in teaching mkt: his slides are personalized, his lectures aren't off the book... But the MC was ridiculous

It'll take you a minute to figure out that his favorite phrase is "Make money forever," and you'll be hearing it all term. Despite his enthusiasm in the material, I couldn't stay focused in his lecture, which never had a break and always ran 5-10 minutes overtime. With the exams being multiple choice, you just need to memorize... everything.

We took our multiple choice final exam 13 days ago and have not gotten our grades back yet. Although he can keep a class somewhat entertained and shows genuine enthusiasm for the material, all other profs use the same lecture slides but can teach better, so you are better off just going with another prof.

Not Recommended. Very boring lecture, never gives a break during class and always goes past the end of class by at least five minutes. I think he likes the sound of his own voice way too much. Lecture was a waste of time. Overall, not a very good prof.
she has a tendancy to shout teach for some reason

Claudia's exams are on everything she talks about in class. People are giving her low stars because they don't show up to lectures. As long as you show up and participate, you'll do fine. Her grading criteria couldn't be more clearer and if you do bad in this course then you obviously didn't put in any effort.

Honestly, Claudia was a very sweet person; she would do her best to help students out and cared for them. However, the class was very disorganized; everyone would usually be confused at her teaching, and her accent made it even worse. The class has a heavy workload with vague grading criteria. There is a lot of group work and read the textbook!

First off, she seems really nice & I imagine she is a sweet lady.

However, I am paying around $1,000 for this class. She is extremely unorganized, confusing and very difficult to understand. I am not happy.

Yes the exams are easy, but she is totally incompetent.

She people may complain that Claudias lectures are hard to understand, possibly because she's ESL, but I thought Claudia was a very good prof. She gave a lecture dedicated to helping on the final and she watered down the final to help us get a better grade. She's good in my experience.

Prof was not great. Her Powerpoint slides had inaccuracies, she could not provide examples on the topics in class, grading criteria was vague, and fairly heavy workload. 1 individual presentation, 2 group presentations, and 1 group report. Upside is tests are easy, all MCQ. pray for a good group
Seems nice, lectures aren't too difficult to understand. Will edit and update once the semester ends.

Yuyu lacks experience as an instructor, but she's really nice, and very approachable for questions, for emails she gave long and detailed responses, unlike other profs who answer with a few words Her marking is fair, and she gives very detailed feedback If you're in her class you should definitely read the textbook for exams

This course is pretty boring for non-marketing students especially difficult for international students. Be ready for papers and presentations. The instructor is very kind and she is passionate about teaching. Exams are pretty hard and do not just focus on the PPT slides, read the book if you have enough review time. The final grade is great.

Yuyu is a nice & approachable person, and you can tell she's passionate about teaching & marketing. That said, there are definitely much better profs to take 343 with. Requirements for both the group assignment and personal branding were so unclear. "80% slide content" for exams was not true at all. Read the book & ask for clarification on HW.

I dont think YuYu is that bad. I think she just started her teaching career she just needs a bit of time to get more experience. But I can tell you that she is tough marker just like her TAs. TA that I had was the worst I have ever seen in my undergraduate career.

Extremely unprofessional! Cant mark and is not clear on what she expects from us. Her lectures are non-essential and have almost no relevancy to the exams as its based on the textbook, even though she originally says only sides. She is also obviously not clear with the TAs - they all mark on their own criteria and expectations.

Yuyu is a sessional prof. Her first impression is excellent. She is inexperienced in teaching tho. Her lecture slides lack details or effort and she just manages to read off the slides at the most. What she teaches can be easily understood without going to class. Her midterm was BRUTAL and unexpected. Too heavy on irrelevant details. thumbs down

Amazing marketing prof - she clearly knows her stuff, and is able to articulate the information at a level suitable for undergrads!  Absolutely fair in markeing; I totally recommend taking at least one university course with her!

Professor South made marketing interesting by incorporating lots of videos and examples into lectures. Although the exams were tough, Cluny highlighted the key learning points in the reading and lecture notes to make review easier. The key to dealing with the ambiguous assignments is going to office hours. I enjoyed this class.

Awful class. Cluny is a good prof while lecturing, however, the course she has designed is awful. Some test questions are ridiculous and the projects throughout the course are time-consuming and extremely unclear. Marketing Rubric is extremely vague and the projects are harshly marked. TAKE WITH SOMEONE ELSE. Extremely poorly designed class.
The rubric she gave is so vague and she got so many freaking assignments, including a networking event.

Don't really like her lecture, did not talk much about the book but just keep elaborating some points but her lecture sometimes are funny tho. her assignments are so vague, dun realli know what she wants and too much workload.

Cluny engages her class with her high energy and entertaining examples. She is always willing to help so if you need clarification on key course concepts be sure to go to her office hours since she gives you detailed explanations.

There are two big projects throughout the semester which require way too much work. The lectures don't really help and there is a lot of memorization to be done for the midterm and final. She assigned an extra lecture for us to watch even though we weren't supposed to have class. The criteria for the work were also not clear so you would lose marks

Her lectures are lively and she shows enthusiasm towards marketing. However, her class materials are unorganized on Canvas and it is difficult to look for the assignments that are due for the week. The information that is given to us for group projects is ambiguous. Many of her midterm questions are from short excerpts in lecture. ATTEND LECTURE!

Great guy, interesting course. Provides a lot of real world examples, and takes polls in class to see different attitudes towards different aspects of marketing. Good prof to take marketing with if you want a good grade!
Useless!!  He doesn't know what he's talking about, there was always something wrong with his lectures, and exam questions were too vague and general! yuck!

Classes weren't useful but you have to go because videos shown in class are tested. Exams are ALL multiple choice. Know all the definitions in the chapters that are tested. Most marking really depends on your TA, so if you get a more lenient TA, then you're in luck. You really don't learn much in class, and only the videos are interesting.
The class requires a lot of work! The key point is you have to be in a good group. The prof is okay overall, but I like my TA better. The contents are not much useful, from my perspective.
The class in general is A LOT of work, but Krider does a good job of communicating the material.  The exams are really fair and pretty much straight out of the textbook.  Definitely recommend him.

This class is not boring. We are dealing with the products and advertisements that surround us in our day to day lives. It's extremely interesting and he provides real life case studies or examples to further explain his point. The textbook is quite interesting and Krider does a great job explaining concepts and ideas. Exams are fair and relevant.

Sine this is an introductory class, the content is broad and general. You have to memorize the entire text and remember everything he talks about in lecture -- even if it is only for 2 sec, because they're all going to be on the exams. Although the exams were all MC, they were tough and the answers were ambiguous. TAs marked hard and very biased.

First of all, this class is a lesson in common sense.  That said, Krider's tendency to tell compelling stories relating class concepts to the real world does add some much needed spice to the bland course curriculum.  If I had to guess, a Krider taught 445 quantitative marketing course would probably be pretty sweet.

Unfair evaluations-assignments marked hard and you will lose marks on criteria not even mentioned; exams require you to pick what HE thinks is the best answer.  final easier than midterm, paper ok. classes boring though he seems passionate about marketing. is rude to students who say "wrong" (in his opinion) answers in class
Krider did not attend to one lecture without any reason. Bad prof, unfair marking. Take this course with Cathy!!
This class is boring and it's not the instructor's fault. He is a helpful guy with good knowledge of Marketing. text and lecture notes would sufice for a good grade.
Boring class.  Just read the textbook and lecture notes, you'll be fine.  The TA marking for assignments was kind of hard tho.  Not very engaging, so you don't have to attend lectures anyways.

This class was very boring. I attended all the lectures and most of the discussion were quite obvious and did not require much analysis. Not his fault, it is an intro marketing class; what do u expect? However, the amount of work was alot. The assignments, presentations and the marketing took alot of effort. The tutorials were fun but alot work!

this class was very boring. we kept having open discussions with ppl saying obvious things and wasting time. asst's required so much work for 4% and the marking was tough in general (from TA)Exams were not too hard but required extensive book reading. Lectures were not important to attend, just do good on your project. disappointed.
Stop Telling your story about Hong Kong. Most of them are wrong in fact.

very clear prof. his explanations in class aren't really important, but the videos are tested, so you have to go to lecture.  exams are all m/c. assignments are annoying because they're harder than the midterm, and they're worth more too! but overall, he's a good prof, and the class is very fair
No Comments
exams were pretty easy as long as you MEMORIZE the WHOLE text book.printing the notes were just waste of ink and money.assignments were confusing and its a lot of work for a 5% assignments.

Kept switching instructions regarding assignments and presentation format, which really annoyed me. The assignments were unclear and marked hard. The worst is, both exams were PURE REGURGITATION.... you memorize the whole textbook you'll get A.
No Comments
No Comments
A well organized prof with pretty good (multiple choice) exams
Seems very disorganized.  I have a hard time respecting him when he does not know if he is coming or going.  Midterm was a fiasco.

Very helpful prof! always willing to help out even with things that don't have to do with the class. Lectures: they are useful but he only goes over the simple topics very clearly then the harder stuff you have to go read in the textbook and build on the simple ones. Exams: simple if you read the book, you'll for sure get an A. Exams are long!

He is really nice professor ever. Not only marketing stuff, but you can also learn some life experiences based on what he talked in lecture. I really enjoyed to study with him. Participations is not required in his lecture but it is great to go and listen. I promise you that you will definitely learn lots of things from his lecture.
After taking his course, I decided to specialize in marketing. His excellent examples and lectures were the best I've had in Beedie. I highly recommend taking his classes.
His exam is really hard to take with! Avoid please.......
His powerpoint slides are clear, but I think he still need to improve the teaching style by first time to teach for this course!
He is very constructive with his material and he speaks very clearly
Hes actually good and knowledgable ignore the positive comments
No Comments
a very nice prof and an easy course. just read the text and u can easily get an A.
One of the easiest business classes i've taken.  All you have to do is memorize your notes and you are set
This Sandhu can't do.  Avoid at all cost.

just memorize his notes, and read the text for the multiple choice. a lot of ppl don't read his notes, so class avg can be low, but if u do, it's easy to get a good mark! not much work req'd compared to other profs.
He's a smart guy, really clear and organised, good if you just want to learn the material but if you are looking for a fun time, not the prof for you.

marketing is such a key course for bba student, but this guy appears totally out of track. You need perfect eyes and ears to just see and hear his words, but don't expect u understand marketing principles from him

Maybe he is not so enthusiastic about teaching, but he always comes organized and prepared. And, he is very passionate about marketing, that's for sure! He is really, really not as bad as the rumors say.
extremely unenthusiastic about teaching. very strict on rules, so better follow them and avoid being creative too, he will mark you wrong.
He's not that bad.
Bad attitude toward students and extremely moody. Don't miss class cuz he's not going to inform you on what you missed.
I don't think he enjoys teaching, probably just for the paycheques.
No Comments
Not really an academic if you know what I mean!
No Comments
He's a nice guy.  His exams are easy, just based on lecture notes and the book.
Not the best prof but he was okay. He was very disorganized but was reachable after class. his office hour was helpful, however, TAs do most of the markings on assignments.

No need to go to lectures. Gordon likes to pick on people to participate. He is also very lazy and takes forever to upload marks. However, his exams are really easy and you will receive an A if you ace them. The other assignments aren't really worth much so little effort is required.
The best prof ever
Hot and funny.  He made watching his lectures very enjoyable!

He's very charming first of all. However, personally I'm not very favor of his teaching style as he teaches nothing from textbook, but exams are all based on textbook. His exam is all MC, but tricky. He doesn't have paper to write but video shooting instead. His slides are NOT downloadable, which is not good.
